definitions.definition: A piece of merchandise available at a very attractive price.
definitions.example: At this price, this car is a steal.

definitions.definition: A situation in which a defensive player actively takes possession of the ball or puck from the opponent's team.
Scoring in an end without the hammer.
A policy in database systems that a database follows which allows a transaction to be written on nonvolatile storage before its commit occurs.
To take illegally, or without the owner's permission, something owned by someone else.
definitions.example: Three irreplaceable paintings were stolen from the gallery.

definitions.definition: (of ideas, words, music, a look, credit, etc.) To appropriate without giving credit or acknowledgement.
definitions.example: They stole my idea for a biodegradable, disposable garbage de-odorizer.

definitions.definition: To get or effect surreptitiously or artfully.
definitions.example: He stole glances at the pretty woman across the street.

definitions.definition: To acquire at a low price.
definitions.example: He stole the car for two thousand less than its book value.

definitions.definition: To draw attention unexpectedly in (an entertainment), especially by being the outstanding performer. Usually used in the phrase steal the show.

definitions.example: He stole across the room, trying not to wake her.

definitions.definition: To advance safely to (another base) during the delivery of a pitch, without the aid of a hit, walk, passed ball, wild pitch, or defensive indifference.
To borrow for a short moment.
